channel.title: Simple, but i need help
channel.description:
i got a stupid challenge problem in math, the maximum is 20(i think) but i really can't be sure for myself, here it is:
In a class of 40 children, 20 can play table tennis and 25 can play soccer. 5 cannot play either table tennis or soccer. How many children can play both table tennis and soccer?

item.title: Simple, but i need help
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Typical SAT style problem…

Activity1 + Activity2 + Neither - Both= Total

20 + 25 = 5 - x = 40
50 - x = 40
x = 10

If you think through it logically though, it will help. If you have 40 kids and 5 cannot do either, you’re left with only 35 doing the activities. But since 20 + 25 = 45 kids doing activities together, you can conclude that 10 kids to both to even it out.

Hope that’s right

Read full topic
